description.narrative: Main activities include: *SUPPORT YPLHIV TO PARTICIPATE ON WORLD AIDS DAY COMMEMORATION AND THE LAUNCH OF YPLHIV ADVOCACY PLATFORM *ENGAGE YPLHIV ON THE CONSELHO NACIONAL DE COMBATE AO SIDA-CNCS TECHNICAL MEETING FOR ADOLESCENT AND YOUTH *CAPACITY BUILD ON SRHR, LAW AND ADVOCACY FOR Y+ PROVINCIAL FOCAL POINTS

S1: Healthcare providers and police are sensitised on the rights of SW, MSM-TG and AGYW S2: Advocacy agenda set: action plan for community-led organisations in place and common objectives identified for coalition building. S4: Relationships with stakeholders, allies and champions among the community, NGOs and within the government established. M1: Community led organisations and inclusive coalitions have the institutional capacity to advocate for their rights and needs.

The civil society gives more pressure to the actual socio-political and economic scenario characterised by public debt and economic crises. As part of joint efforts by civil society and the government there is legislation reform taking place concerning various public sectors. For instance, recently, parliamentarians approved a law that criminalises child marriage, which is very important stage on the HIV response. Furthermore, by October 2019, there will be presidential and provincial assembly election and by next year parliamentarians will be revising the labour law. This socio-political context and legal reform create a great opportunity for the Young People Living with HIV to actively engage with the civil society to meaningfully influence the decision making process of their lives.

sector.narrative: PITCH H&O Mozambique REPSSI Human rights
PITCH H&O Mozambique REPSSI Social mitigation of HIV/AIDS
